 (1)…………… , the garden party has been cancelled.

2. There isn't enough space for me to park my car there.  
**fit**
 My car (2)…………… in that space.

3. Phone me immediately after you arrive at the conference.  
**soon**
 (3)…………… at the conference, telephone me.

4. Who does this pen belong to?  
**whose**
 Do you know (4)…………… ?

5. The amount of money spent on the project makes it very important.  
**of**
 This project (5)…………… owing to the money spent on it.

6. At first, I couldn't speak Russian. Now I find it easy.  
**got**
 Eventually, I (6)…………… Russian.

7. Is your house big enough to take us if we come and stay for a few days?  
**room**
 Is there (7)…………… if we come and stay for a few days?

8. Although it was raining, we had the barbecue.  
**spite**
 In (8)…………… , we had the barbecue.

correct_answer.2: doesn't fit / won't fit / does not fit / will not fit
correct_answer.4: whose this pen is / whose pen this is

title_like: %Do you regret leaving your job now?  %
question_text:
1. Do you regret leaving your job now?  
**you**
 Do you wish (1)…………… job now?

2. Could you try a little harder to listen to what I'm saying?  
**effort**
 Can you (2)…………… listen to what I'm saying?

3. It doesn't matter which chemical you put into the mixture first. The results will be the same.  
**difference**
 It (3)…………… you put into the mixture first.

4. My mother said I could go with you only if I return home by 5pm.  
**long**
 I can go with you (4)…………… home by 5pm.

5. Unfortunately, I couldn't see you because I didn't have time.  
**able**
 If I had had more time, I (5)…………… see you.

6. These windows need cleaning again.  
**have**
 These windows will (6)…………… .

7. It wasn't a good idea resigning from your job before you have another one.  
**better**
 It would (7)…………… hadn't resigned from your job.

8. Hardly any of the cars on special offer were left when we arrived.  
**nearly**
 By the time we arrived, (8)…………… had been bought.

correct_answer.1: you hadn't left your / you had not left your
correct_answer.4: as long as i return / so long as i return

title_like: %The Queen is launching this ship tomorrow morni%
question_text:
1. The Queen is launching this ship tomorrow morning.  
**being**
 This (1)…………… the Queen tomorrow morning.

2. Could you try and spend a little less on Christmas presents this year.  
**rather**
 I (2)…………… money on Christmas presents this year.

3. If you find a dress cheaper in another store, can you tell me?  
**let**
 (3)…………… if you find the dress cheaper elsewhere.

4. Can you distribute these tests to the other students Kathy?  
**hand**
 Can you (4)…………… Kathy?

5. The report says a child was operating the machine.  
**being**
 According to the report, (5)…………… by a child.

6. I didn't see anyone wearing yellow at the dinner.  
**nobody**
 There (6)…………… at the dinner.

7. I can't wait to see Margaret's face when we arrive.  
**forward**
 I'm (7)…………… Margaret's face when we arrive.

8. Once you give me a full description of the hotel, I can decide whether or not to go there.  
**describe**
 I can decide to go to the hotel after (8)…………… .

correct_answer.4: hand out these tests / hand these tests out
correct_answer.8: you describe it to me / you describe it / you describe it fully

title_like: %In my opinion, it was an error to give him so m%
question_text:
1. In my opinion, it was an error to give him so much money so young.  
**should**
 He (1)…………… so much money at such a young age.

2. Do you think this antique vase is good value for money?  
**worth**
 In your opinion, is (2)…………… buying?

3. The lesson was cancelled as only three students came.  
**turned**
 Only (3)…………… the lesson, so it was cancelled.

4. The picnic was cancelled due to the rain.  
**because**
 The picnic (4)…………… rain.

5. When you get to the large oak tree, keep going until you get to the lake.  
**carry**
 After getting to the large oak tree, (5)…………… until you get to the lake.

6. This is the most expensive book we've seen so far in this shop.  
**more**
 There hasn't (6)…………… than this in the shop so far.

7. Whose is this bicycle?  
**belong**
 Who (7)…………… to?

8. She doesn't usually eat three meals a day, so she got full pretty quickly.  
**used**
 She (8)…………… three meals a day, so she got full quickly.

correct_answer.1: should not have been given / should not have had / shouldn't have been given / shouldn't have had
correct_answer.3: three students turned up for / three students turned up to
correct_answer.5: carry on / carry on walking / carry on going
correct_answer.8: isn't used to eating / is not used to eating

title_like: %That fence is there to prevent you entering the%
question_text:
1. That fence is there to prevent you entering the grounds of the house.  
**so/can't**
 They put the fence there (1)…………… enter the grounds of the house.

2. Does your brother have the ability to take so many exams in the same week?  
**capable**
 Is (2)…………… so many exams in the same week?

3. We were able to cross the river, despite the strong current.  
**succeeded**
 We (3)…………… despite the strong current.

4. I would prefer you to leave now. Goodbye.  
**rather**
 I (4)…………… now. Goodbye.

5. I think you should say sorry for your behavior.  
**apologise**
 I think (5)…………… behaviour.

6. I have a lot to do so I can't come with you to the cinema this afternoon.  
**too**
 I have (6)…………… to be able to come to the cinema.

7. Entrance into the museum is free today.  
**costs**
 It (7)…………… the museum today.

8. All the cars have been cleaned except the manager's.  
**which**
 The manager's is the (8)…………… been cleaned.

correct_answer.1: so you can't / so you cannot / so you won't / so you will not / so you don't / so you do not
correct_answer.8: only car which hasn't / only car which has not

title_like: %I have never read such a funny book%
question_text:
1. This is the funniest book I've ever read. 
**such**
 I have never read (1)…………… book.

2. A builder is going to paint our house next week. 
**have**
 We are going to (2)…………… painted next week.

3. You won't pass the exam if you don't study hard. 
**unless**
 You won't pass the exam (3)…………… hard.

4. "Where are you going?" asked Tom. 
**wanted**
 Tom (4)…………… I was going.

5. It's been a long time since we met. 
**not**
 We (5)…………… a long time.

6. I'm sure he is at home because the lights are on. 
**must**
 He (6)…………… at home because the lights are on.

7. "Don't forget to buy milk," said my mother. 
**reminded**
 My mother (7)…………… milk.

8. It is very difficult for me to learn Chinese. 
**find**
 I (8)…………… to learn Chinese.

correct_answer.5: have not met for / haven't met for
correct_answer.8: find it very difficult / find it really difficult

title_like: %I prefer playing tennis to playing football%
question_text:
1. I prefer playing tennis to playing football. 
**rather**
 I (1)…………… tennis than play football.

2. The coffee was too hot to drink. 
**enough**
 The coffee (2)…………… to drink.

3. It's a pity I didn't go to the party. 
**wish**
 I (3)…………… to the party.

4. My car is faster than yours. 
**as**
 Your car (4)…………… mine.

5. There is no point in asking him. 
**worth**
 It (5)…………… him.

6. We will finish the project by Friday. 
**have**
 By Friday, we (6)…………… the project.

7. We have no sugar left. 
**run**
 We (7)…………… sugar.

8. Although it was raining, we went out. 
**spite**
 In (8)…………… rain, we went out.

correct_answer.2: was not cool enough / wasn't cool enough / was not cold enough
correct_answer.3: wish I had gone / wish I'd gone
correct_answer.4: is not as fast as / isn't as fast as
correct_answer.5: is not worth asking / isn't worth asking
correct_answer.7: have run out of / 've run out of
